1:64, the USSR used about 20 percent of its GNP for military spending, whereas the United States, France, and Britain spent 5 to 10 percent of their GNPs for military purposes. The United States devoted about 3 to 4 percent of its oil consumption to the military. A single F-16, a work horse of the Air Force from 1979 onward, used more fuel in an afternoon than the average American family vehicle did over two years. 2 On the interstate system and its ecological effects
